newsitem.title: USA: CalEnergy launches bid for N.Y. utility.
newsitem.headline: CalEnergy launches bid for N.Y. utility.

text.p: Power company CalEnergy Co. Inc. said Tuesday it would launch a $159 million offer for 9.9 percent of New York State Electric & Gas Corp. as the first part of an attempt to buy the whole company.

CalEnergy offered to pay $24.50 per share for the statke and said it was making the move after the New York company decided not to pursue a transaction. It also said it would be willing to pay $27.50 per share for the whole company in a negotiated transaction.
